div.font: Welcome to Southeast Fountain School Corporation! Southeast Fountain Schools, in partnership with the community, maintains a safe and caring environment and provides students opportunities to develop skills for lifelong learning.

td.div:
School Closure Update COVID-19 -- (released April 2, 2020)
Please view the document below for an update from SEFSC Superintendent, Dan Foster.
School Closure Update COVID-19 (4-2-2020)
School Closure Update COVID-10 (4-2-2020) (Spanish version)​

ul.li: The site below is kept updated with lists of Food Banks and Meal Distribution sites throughout Indiana.

li.span: Elementary School has opened online pre-registration for Kindergarten Round-Up for the 2020-2021 school year.
We have an online form for all parents of
students to fill out. This will help us gather new student information and contact information for new parents/guardians.

ul.li: We ask that the forms please be completed by May 1, 2020 if you are enrolling your new Kindergarten student at SEF Elementary for the 2020-2021 school year.​

li.span: For questions, please send an email to
Click the following link to complete the Kindergarten Pre-Registration form:

br.br:
Dear Parents/Guardians,
We hope you and your family are well and staying safe from the virus. Please keep promoting social distancing as much as possible. On behalf of the Board of School Trustees and the entire staff at Southeast Fountain, I want to thank you so much for your patience during this unprecedented situation. Clearly we are in uncharted territory and there is no wrong answer because I'm not sure
there is a right answer for everything transpiring. However,In an attempt to answer some of your questions, we have created a COVID-19/Coronavirus website that can be found:
https://www.sites.google.com/sefschools.org/covid-19/home
I encourage you to scroll the tabs at the top of the page for more specific information. Each school is listed with personnel for school-specific questions (administration, athletics, guidance, technology, etc.), however, if you find yourself with a question and you just aren't sure where to send the question, we have created a COVID19info@sefschools.org email address that will send an email to the administrative team and we will respond accordingly.
We are in the process of providing guidance to instructional staff with ways to check in with their students and offer suggestions for curriculum (as does the “Student Learning” tab on the website). They will be reaching out to students soon. Included in that information will be a consent form to allow your student(s) to participate in online discussions.
As you are aware, Governor Holcomb has closed all Indiana schools until at least May 1st. I do not know if this will be extended through the remainder of this school year or not at this time. Please prepare yourselves for the possibility of returning this school year as well as the possibility of not returning this school year. We likely will not have this information for a few more weeks.
In closing, I want to be perfectly clear that there is no requirement for work to be done and graded nor participation in online discussions; however, since we as the SEF community at large are not ready for eLearning we feel that providing some resources and discussions with teachers may prove helpful to those of you at home trying to keep a sense of normalcy for your child(ren). We fully understand and appreciate the challenges this closure has caused many of our families and we pledge to do our best to help you work through the situation.
​Respectfully,
Dan L. Foster, Ed.S.
Superintendent

ul.li: Please view the following PDF for information provided by the Indiana Department of Education released on March 19, 2020 pertaining to Indiana assessments: doe_covid-19_spring_testing_decision.pdf
